gave up years ago keeping
a diary. When | was very young
lit seemed cons at times), at
tempted to keep a day to day
record Of my life. 1t proved futile
and frustrating. There were al
ways so many activities, includ-
ing scrapes and tantrums, that
those small pages were made
quate. Also, there were many
events that one does not want
to record.


For the past week l have been
involved in such a wide circle
of happenings that | feel one
more incident would be too much.


The words of a famous Scot
fish poet, Robert Burns, who said
"the best laid plans of mice
and men often go astray,"
should become our family mot
TO.


Last Thursday was to be the
time for a gala Thanksgiving
dinner at our home. We had in
vited a friend from England and
another from Sweden to partake
of our goose and trimmings.


An invitation from the owners
of the Comeback Inn was accept
ed and we agreed to postpone our
Thanksgiving dinner until the fol-
lowing Sunday. Our English friend
popped in for short visit on
Thanksgiving Day, but a virus
felled my spouse and | went to
the Comeback Inn alone for
dinner.


! was seated at the hosts
table, Mr.. and Mrs. Jack Stew
art, who are two of the most
affable persons l have ever met,
